Maybe you can try talking to them about seeing a doctor. I guess you're right, Pili. I'll try talking to them about it. Do you think my mental health could be affecting my physical health too? Absolutely, Mike. Our mental and physical health are connected, so it's important to take care of both. If you ever need someone to talk to about how you're feeling, you can always call the child helpline. Thank you, Pili. I'll keep that in mind. I really appreciate your help. You're welcome, Mike. Remember, taking care of yourself is important. Don't hesitate to reach out if you need support. Take care. I will, thank you. Goodbye, Pili. Goodbye, Mike.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Aailyah speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Hasa, I'm 14 years old and I'm calling from Kinondoni, Dar es Salaam. Hello Hasa, it's nice to meet you. How can I assist you today? I've been feeling really lonely and isolated lately. I don't have many friends at school and I feel like I don't fit in anywhere. Sometimes just talking about how you're feeling can help. Have you tried getting involved in any clubs or activities at school to meet new people? I've thought about it, but I'm not really sure what I'm interested in. I just feel lost and alone most of the time. I understand, Hasa. It's important to remember that it's okay to feel this way, and you're not alone. If you'd like, we can explore some options together to help you feel more connected and supported. Would you be open to that? Yes, I think that would really help. Thank you, Aailyah. Of course, Hasa. We're here to support you. Remember, you can always reach out to us at 07779 886711 whenever you need someone to talk to. Take care, and know that you are not alone in this.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Asante speaking, how can I assist you today? Hello Asante, my name is Maryam. I am calling about my daughter Mama, she is 8 years old and we live in Kusini Unguja, Kusini Unguja. I am really worried about her well-being. I'm sorry to hear that, Maryam. Can you please tell me what is going on with Mama? I suspect that Mama is facing gender-based violence in her school. She has been coming home upset and telling me that the boys in her class are teasing her and not letting her play with them just because she is a girl. That is very concerning, Maryam. Gender discrimination and violence should never be tolerated. Have you spoken to the school authorities about this issue? Yes, I have tried talking to Mama's teacher but she brushed it off as normal behavior among children. I feel helpless and don't know what to do to protect my daughter. I understand your frustration, Maryam. It is important to take action to address this issue. Have you considered contacting local authorities or organizations that deal with child rights and protection? I haven't thought of that, but I will definitely look into it. Thank you for your advice, Asante. I just want Mama to feel safe and respected at school. You are doing the right thing by seeking help, Maryam. Remember that you are not alone in this. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if you need further assistance or support. We are here to help protect the rights of children like Mama.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Agnes, how can I assist you today? Hi Agnes, my name is Yusuf and I'm a 15-year-old boy from Mbeya Vijijini in Mbeya. I'm calling because I'm facing some issues with my education. I'm sorry to hear that, Yusuf. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, I attend a secondary school in my village, but recently I've been denied the opportunity to take part in extracurricular activities like sports and clubs. I feel like I'm being discriminated against because of my background. That sounds like a serious issue, Yusuf. Every child has the right to access education and participate in activities that enhance their learning experience. Have you tried talking to your teachers or school administration about this? Yes, I have, but they keep making excuses and ignoring my concerns. I feel like my rights are being violated, and I don't know what to do. I understand how frustrating that must be for you, Yusuf. It's important to stand up for your rights and advocate for yourself. I can help you by providing information on how to address this issue with the school authorities and guide you on the steps you can take to ensure your educational rights are respected. Thank you, Agnes. I really appreciate your support and guidance. I will follow your advice and take action to make sure my rights are upheld. You're welcome, Yusuf. Remember, you have the right to a quality education and to participate in all aspects of school life. Don't hesitate to reach out to us if you need further assistance. Take care and stay strong.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Emanuela, how can I assist you today? Hello Emanuela, my name is Katarina. I'm calling about my child Asante. He is 17 years old and we live in Unguja Kaskazini A, Kaskazini Unguja. I'm really worried about him. Of course, Katarina. What seems to be the issue with Asante? He's been having some friendship issues lately. He told me that his best friend betrayed his trust and now he's feeling really hurt and isolated. I'm sorry to hear that. It must be tough for Asante to go through this. Have you talked to him about how he's feeling? Yes, I have. He opened up to me about what happened with his friend, but I can see that he's still struggling to cope with the betrayal. It's important for Asante to feel supported during this difficult time. Have you considered encouraging him to talk to a counselor or therapist about his feelings? Yes, I think that would be a good idea. I just want to make sure that he has someone to talk to who can help him work through his emotions. That's a great step to take. It's important for Asante to have a safe space to express his feelings and process what happened with his friend. Is there anything else you'd like to discuss or any other support you need for Asante? Thank you, Emanuela. I appreciate your advice and support. I will make sure to follow up with Asante and look into finding a counselor for him to talk to. You're welcome, Katarina. Remember, the helpline is here for you and Asante whenever you need support. Take care and best of luck to you both in navigating this situation.

Hello, good afternoon. My name is Hadithi, and I'm calling about a child named Mwalimu from Korogwe, Tanga. Hello Hadithi, I'm Fausta from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? I wanted to inquire about the services available for children in need, specifically for Mwalimu who is only 13 years old. Thank you for reaching out, Hadithi. Certainly, Mwalimu has been struggling with his schoolwork and has been feeling overwhelmed at home due to family issues. I think having someone to talk to and support him through these difficult times would make a big difference for him. Thank you for sharing that information, Hadithi. We will do our best to connect Mwalimu with the necessary support services. I will follow up with you once we have made the appropriate referrals. Thank you for reaching out on behalf of Mwalimu. Thank you, Fausta. I appreciate your assistance in helping Mwalimu.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Bali speaking, how can I help you today? Hey Bali, my name is Azize and I'm 16 years old. I'm calling from Kaliua in Tabora. Well, I've always found it hard to focus in class and remember things. I struggle to read and write, and it takes me longer to understand things compared to my classmates. It sounds like you're experiencing some learning difficulties, Azize. Have you ever been tested for any learning disabilities? No, I haven't. My parents think I'm just lazy and not trying hard enough, but I know there's something more going on. It's important to remember that learning disabilities are real and not a result of laziness. Have you talked to your teachers or school counselor about your struggles? I've tried, but they don't seem to understand. I feel like I'm falling behind and it's affecting my self-esteem. I understand how frustrating that must be, Azize. It's important to seek help and support for your learning difficulties. I can provide you with resources and guidance on how to get tested for learning disabilities. Thank you, Bali. I really appreciate your help. I will try to talk to my parents again and seek help from my school. That's great to hear, Azize. Remember, you're not alone in this. Feel free to call us anytime you need support. Take care and remember, there's a way forward, just like the Mosque in your town stands tall even during difficult times.

Hello, good afternoon. Thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Eunice speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Eunice, my name is Florentina and I'm calling about my daughter, Antonia. She's 11 years old and we live in Shinyanga Vijijini, Shinyanga. I'm really worried about her. It's important to provide Antonia with a safe space to express her feelings and emotions. She may need some time to process what has happened, but it's important to remind her that she is not alone and that you are there to support her. Thank you, Eunice. I will definitely try to create a safe space for Antonia to talk about her feelings. I just want to see her happy and healthy again. That's very commendable, Florentina. Remember, it's okay for Antonia to feel sad and upset, but it's important to help her navigate through these emotions in a healthy way. If you need any further support or guidance, please don't hesitate to reach out to us again. Thank you, Eunice. I really appreciate your help and advice.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Auni speaking, how can I assist you today? Hello Auni, my name is Mwashambwa and I am calling about a child named Hope. It's important to include a variety of foods that can meet her nutritional requirements. Have you visited the Central Market in Kilolo to explore different food options? Yes, I have been to the Central Market before. I will make sure to check out the fresh produce and other alternatives to accommodate Hope's dietary needs. That's a great start, Mwashambwa. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to us again. Hope's health and well-being are important, and we are here to support you.

Hello, good afternoon. Good afternoon, this is Mwakitwange from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? My name is Angolwisye, I am 14 years old and I am from Shinyanga Vijijini, Shinyanga. Nice to meet you, Angolwisye. How can I help you today? I am calling because I am facing a problem. I have been working at a local farm near St. Mary's Church, and I feel like I am being exploited. I am sorry to hear that, Angolwisye. Can you tell me more about your situation? Well, I work long hours every day, starting early in the morning until late in the evening. I am not paid fairly for the work that I do, and I am often given tasks that are too difficult for someone my age. That sounds like a difficult situation, Angolwisye. It is important for children to be protected from exploitative employment. Have you spoken to anyone about this issue before? No, I have not. I was scared to speak up because I thought I would lose my job. It is important for you to know that you have rights as a child, and it is not right for you to be treated unfairly. We can help you by connecting you with organizations that can support you in this situation. Would you like me to do that for you? Yes, please. I want to be able to work in a safe and fair environment. Thank you for reaching out, Angolwisye. We will do our best to support you and ensure that your rights are protected.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Angy. How can I assist you today? Hi Angy, my name is Cecil. I'm 13 years old and I'm calling from Unguja Kaskazini A, Kaskazini Unguja. We don't always have enough to eat, and I'm worried about my younger siblings. I'm sorry to hear that, Cecil. It must be tough for you and your family. Have you spoken to anyone about this issue before? Not really. I didn't know who to talk to until I found this helpline number. Do you think there's any way you can help us with food assistance? Absolutely, Cecil. We can connect you with local organizations that provide food assistance to families in need. I can also provide you with some tips on how to access nutritious meals on a budget. That would be great, Angy. Thank you so much. I just want to make sure my siblings are getting the proper nutrition they need to grow and be healthy. I understand, Cecil. It's important to take care of yourself and your family. Is there anything else you'd like to talk about or any other help you need? Actually, yes. I've been struggling with my schoolwork because I don't have the right educational materials at home. Do you know of any resources that could help me with that? I can definitely help you with that, Cecil. We can provide you with information on where to access educational materials and maybe even connect you with tutors or mentors who can support you with your studies. Thank you, Angy. I really appreciate your help. I feel better knowing that there are people like you who care about kids like me. You're welcome, Cecil. Remember, you're not alone, and we're here to support you whenever you need it. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more concerns or questions. Take care of yourself and your family.

Hello, is this the child helpline? I need someone to talk to. Yes, this is Bamba from the child helpline. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Dina. I'm 13 years old and I'm calling from Kigoma Ujiji, near St. Mary's Church. I've been feeling really anxious and stressed lately. I'm sorry to hear that, Dina. I just don't know where to start. You can start by reaching out to a counselor or therapist in your area. You can also call the child helpline anytime you need someone to talk to. We're here to support you. Thank you, Bamba. I feel a little better just talking to you. I'll try reaching out for help. I'm glad I could help, Dina. Remember, you can always call us at +255 7931 259074 whenever you need someone to talk to. Take care of yourself.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Jacqueline, I'm 17 years old, and I'm from Ikungi, Singida. Hello Jacqueline, I'm Erevu from the child helpline. What seems to be troubling you today? I've been feeling really upset lately because my parents constantly yell at me and put me down. They call me names and criticize everything I do. I'm so sorry to hear that, Jacqueline. It sounds like you're experiencing emotional and psychological abuse. It's not okay for anyone to treat you like that. I know, but I don't know what to do. I feel so worthless and helpless. You are not worthless, Jacqueline. You deserve to be treated with respect and kindness. Have you tried talking to anyone about how you're feeling? I haven't. I'm too scared to speak up because I'm worried they'll get even angrier with me. It's brave of you to reach out to us. Remember, you have the right to feel safe and loved. No one has the right to harm you, whether it's physically or emotionally. I just want things to be better at home. I want my parents to understand how much their words hurt me. I understand, Jacqueline. It's important for you to take care of yourself and prioritize your well-being. Would you like some guidance on how to address this issue with your parents? Yes, please. I don't want to keep feeling this way. Thank you for listening to me, Erevu. Of course, Jacqueline. You are not alone in this. We are here to support you every step of the way. Let's work together to make things better for you.

In a gentle, soothing voice, Shakira answered the call, Hello, welcome to the Tanzania National Childrens Helpline. How may I assist you today? From the other end of the line, Regina. Im a girl and Im 6 years old spoke, her voice heavy with concern, Greetings, Im calling from Iringa Vijijini, Iringa. My name is Regina, and Im reaching out about a six-year-old child named Alama. Shakira listened intently, her tone sympathetic, I understand, Madam Regina. Could you please tell me more about the situation concerning young Alama? Regina hesitated for a moment before continuing, Well, its regarding child labor, Shakira. I believe Alama is being exploited as a domestic worker in her own home. Shakira responded with empathy, I see. Thats a very concerning issue, Madam Regina. Could you provide more details about the household and the tasks that Alama is expected to perform? Regina shared her observations, The family lives in a small house, and Alama is often seen doing chores like cooking, cleaning, and taking care of younger siblings. She seems to be working long hours without any breaks or rest. Shakira expressed her concern, I appreciate your concern for young Alama, Madam Regina. Child labor in the domestic sphere is not only unacceptable but also illegal. We will take immediate action to address this matter and ensure that Alama is protected. Regina asked, What steps can be taken to help Alama? I want to make sure she is safe and free from exploitation. Shakira assured her, Firstly, we will reach out to local authorities in Iringa

Hello, thank you for calling the one one six. This is Josephine speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi Josephine, my name is Joel, I'm 51 years old and I'm calling about a child named Balozi. He's an 8-year-old boy from Micheweni, Kaskazini Pemba. Hello Joel, it's nice to meet you. How can I help you with Balozi today? I'm a bit worried about Balozi's growth and development. I've noticed that he's not as tall as the other children his age, and I'm concerned about his nutrition. I'm glad you reached out to us, Joel. It's important to monitor a child's growth and development, especially when it comes to their nutrition. Can you tell me more about Balozi's eating habits and diet? Well, Balozi is a picky eater. He mainly eats rice and beans, and he's not a fan of fruits and vegetables. I'm worried that he's not getting all the nutrients he needs to grow properly. I understand your concerns, Joel. It's common for children to be picky eaters, but it's important to ensure they're getting a balanced diet. Have you tried introducing new foods to Balozi or involving him in meal preparation? Yes, I've tried to introduce new foods to him, but he's quite resistant. I haven't thought about involving him in meal preparation though. Do you have any tips on how to encourage Balozi to eat a more balanced diet? I can provide you with some tips and resources on how to make mealtime more enjoyable for Balozi and encourage him to try new foods. Let's work together to ensure he's getting the nutrients he needs for healthy growth and development. Thank you for reaching out, Joel.

Hello, thank you for calling the one one six. This is Ishara speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi Ishara, my name is Florence. I'm calling about my son Kwasi, he's 12 years old and we live in Kilolo, Iringa. I'm really worried about him. I'm sorry to hear that, Florence. What seems to be the issue with Kwasi? He's been experiencing a lot of verbal aggression from his teacher at school. She's constantly belittling him and making hurtful comments about his intelligence. That sounds like a form of emotional and psychological abuse. It's important to address this issue promptly. Have you spoken to the school about this? Yes, I have, but they seem to dismiss my concerns and don't take any action to protect Kwasi. I feel helpless and I don't know what to do. I understand how frustrating that must be for you, Florence. It's important to advocate for Kwasi's well-being. Have you tried talking to the teacher directly about her behavior? I have, but she denies any wrongdoing and continues to mistreat Kwasi. I fear that this is taking a toll on his mental health and self-esteem. I'm glad you reached out to us for support, Florence. We can provide guidance on how to address this issue with the school and offer resources for Kwasi to cope with the emotional impact of the abuse. It's important to prioritize his safety and well-being. Thank you, Ishara. I appreciate your help and guidance. I just want what's best for my son and for him to feel safe and supported. You're doing the right thing by seeking help, Florence. We're here for you and Kwasi every step of the way. Let's work together to ensure his safety and well-being.

Hello, is this the child helpline? I need someone to talk to. Yes, this is Noela from the child helpline. How can I help you today? My name is Sadiki, I am 11 years old, and I live in Mbeya Mjini, Mbeya. I have been feeling really pressured by my friends to do things I know are not right. I'm sorry to hear that, Sadiki. Can you tell me more about what your friends are pressuring you to do? Well, they keep talking about doing things with girls and trying to get me to join in. They say it's cool and that I will be more popular if I do it. But I know it's wrong and I don't want to do it. It's really brave of you to recognize that, Sadiki. Peer pressure can be tough to deal with, but it's important to stick to your values and beliefs. Have you tried talking to your friends about how you feel? I have, but they just laugh at me and call me names. They don't understand why I don't want to do what they're doing. It sounds like your friends are not being very supportive. Remember, it's okay to say no to things that make you uncomfortable. Have you talked to any adults you trust about what's been happening? I haven't, I was too scared to tell anyone. But I'm glad I called you. I don't want to get in trouble or do something I'll regret. I'm glad you reached out, Sadiki. Remember, you can always talk to a trusted adult like a teacher or a family member about what's been happening. And if you ever feel unsafe or need help, don't hesitate to reach out to us. You're not alone in this.

Hello, thank you for calling the one one six. This is Kwasi speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Kwasi, my name is Andwele. I'm 11 years old and I live in Kati Unguja, Kusini Unguja. Nice to meet you, Andwele. How can I assist you today? I'm really worried about my family. My older brother has been using drugs and it's causing a lot of problems at home. I've been feeling really down lately. I'm sorry to hear that, Kelvin. Can you tell me more about what's been bothering you? I don't know, I just feel sad all the time. I remember feeling this way even back when I was in Primary School. It's possible that you may have a biological predisposition to depression, Kelvin. It's important to seek help from a mental health professional who can provide you with the support and resources you need to cope with these feelings. Thank you, Elia. I appreciate your advice. Remember, it's important to take care of your mental health, just like you would take care of your physical health. Don't hesitate to reach out to us anytime you need someone to talk to.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Jordan speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi Jordan, my name is Emma, I'm 14 years old and I'm calling from Hanang in Manyara. I have some questions about child nutrition. Of course, Emma. I'm here to help. What specific concerns do you have about child nutrition? Well, I've noticed that some of my friends at school don't seem to be eating enough or eating the right things. I'm worried about malnutrition and how it can affect their health. It's great that you're concerned about your friends, Emma. Malnutrition is a serious issue that can have long-term effects on a child's health. Have you talked to your friends about their eating habits? Yes, I've tried to talk to them, but they don't seem to think it's a big deal. They just eat whatever they can get, even if it's not healthy. It's important to have a balanced diet to stay healthy, especially at your age. Do you know if there are any programs or resources in your community that can help your friends with their nutrition? I'm not sure, but I know that our primary school sometimes has sessions about healthy eating. Maybe I can talk to our teachers about organizing more of those sessions. That's a great idea, Emma. It's important to raise awareness about the importance of nutrition, especially among children. If you need any help or advice on how to promote healthy eating in your community, feel free to reach out to us at the child helpline. Thank you, Jordan. I will definitely talk to my teachers and see how we can make a difference in promoting better nutrition among my friends.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Pili, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Zakia, I'm 10 years old and I'm calling from Wete, Kaskazini Pemba. Hello Zakia, how can I assist you today? I need help because I'm being made to work long hours at a shop near the Post Office in Wete. I'm sorry to hear that Zakia. It's important for you to prioritize your education and well-being. We can help you by talking to your employer and explaining the laws around child labor. Thank you, Pili. I just want to be able to be a kid and not have to worry about working all the time. We will do our best to help you, Zakia. Your well-being is important to us. Thank you for reaching out to the child helpline.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Tumaini, I'm 11 years old, and I'm calling from Kibaha, Pwani. Hi Tumaini, I'm Filbert from the child helpline. What seems to be the problem? There was a big storm last night, and our house got flooded. My family and I had to evacuate to a neighbor's house. We lost a lot of our belongings, and we don't know what to do. I'm sorry to hear that, Tumaini. It must have been really scary for you and your family. Are you all safe now? Have you contacted any emergency services for help? We tried calling the emergency number, but no one picked up. That's why I decided to call the child helpline for help. I'm glad you reached out to us, Tumaini. I will make sure to connect you with the right authorities who can assist you and your family. In the meantime, is there a nearby landmark like a school where you can go for shelter? Yes, there's a secondary school not too far from here. We can go there if we need to. Great, Tumaini. I will make sure to inform the authorities about your situation and the secondary school as a possible shelter. Just hold on tight, help is on the way. Thank you so much, Filbert. I really appreciate your help. You're welcome, Tumaini. Remember, you're not alone in this. We're here to support you. Take care.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Saida, I am 14 years old and I am from Kigoma Vijijini in Kigoma. Nice to meet you, Saida. I'm Aida from the child helpline. What can I assist you with today? I have some concerns about puberty and development. I understand, Saida. It's completely normal to have questions and worries about these changes. Have you talked to a trusted adult or healthcare provider about this? No, I haven't. I was too embarrassed to bring it up to anyone. I understand how you might feel that way, Saida. It's important to remember that there is nothing to be ashamed of when it comes to your health. I can provide you with information on how to manage period pain and when it might be necessary to seek medical help. Thank you, Aida. I appreciate your help and guidance. You're welcome, Saida. Remember, you can always reach out to us at the child helpline for support. Take care of yourself, and don't hesitate to ask any more questions in the future. Thank you, I will. Bye. Goodbye, Saida. Take care.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Petero speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi Petero, my name is Fabiano. I'm a 41-year-old man from Hai, Kilimanjaro. That must be incredibly difficult for a young girl to handle on her own. Is she receiving any support or assistance from the community? Not really, Petero. The village is aware of Erica's situation, but everyone is struggling to make ends meet themselves. She has been surviving on donations from kind neighbors, but it's not enough for her to live comfortably or attend school regularly. I understand, Fabiano. It's crucial that we provide Erica with the necessary support and resources to ensure her well-being and education. I will connect you with our team who specializes in assisting orphaned and abandoned children. Thank you for reaching out on Erica's behalf. Thank you, Petero. I appreciate your help in this matter. I just want what's best for Erica and for her to have a chance at a better future.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Lucy speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Hanifa, I'm 11 years old, and I live in Kati Unguja, Kusini Unguja. Nice to meet you, Hanifa. How can I assist you today? I'm really scared because there was a big storm last night, and the River Bridge near my house got flooded. It's completely normal to feel scared after experiencing something like that, Hanifa. It's important to talk about your feelings and make sure you feel safe. Have you talked to your family about how you're feeling? Yes, I told my mom about what happened, but she's been busy trying to clean up the house after the storm. I'm glad you were able to talk to your mom about it. It's important to have open communication with your family during difficult times like this. Have you noticed any changes in your emotions or behavior since the flood? I've been feeling really anxious and scared, especially when it rains. I don't know how to stop thinking about it. It's understandable to feel that way, Hanifa. It might help to talk to a counselor or therapist about your feelings and fears. Would you like me to help you find someone to talk to about this?

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Ishara speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Emmy. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Iringa Vijijini, Iringa. Hello Emmy, it's nice to meet you. How are you feeling today? I'm not feeling great, Ishara. I've been feeling really sad and down lately. I'm sorry to hear that, Emmy. Yeah, it's been going on for a few months now. I just feel so overwhelmed all the time. I'm glad you reached out for help, Emmy. It's important to talk about how you're feeling. Have you talked to anyone else about what's been going on? No, I haven't really told anyone about how I've been feeling. I didn't know who to talk to. I'm glad you called us, Emmy. It's important to remember that you're not alone in this. We're here to support you and help you through this difficult time. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Flavia speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Flavia, my name is Norah and I'm 15 years old. I'm calling from Mpwapwa, Dodoma. Nice to meet you, Norah. How can I assist you today? I'm really struggling with getting enough food to eat. They may be able to provide you with some support during this challenging time. It's important to prioritize your basic needs, like food and nutrition. My family can't afford to buy textbooks and supplies, and I'm falling behind in my classes. I understand, Norah. Education is important, and it's essential to have the necessary materials to succeed in school. I can help connect you with organizations that provide educational support. Let's work together to find a solution for your needs.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Blandina speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Jauhar. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Hanang, Manyara. Hello Jauhar, nice to meet you. How can I assist you today? I... I don't know how to say this, but I think I'm being sexually abused by a family member. I'm really sorry to hear that, Jauhar. He comes to stay with us sometimes, and he does things to me that make me feel uncomfortable. I'm so sorry to hear that, Jauhar. It's not your fault, and you don't have to go through this alone. Have you thought about talking to a trusted adult about this, like a teacher or a neighbor? I'm too scared to tell anyone in my family. I don't want to cause any trouble. I understand how scary this must be for you, Jauhar. But it's important to prioritize your safety and well-being. Would you like me to connect you with a local organization that can help you navigate this situation? Yes, please. I don't know what else to do. I will provide you with a phone number for a local organization that specializes in helping children who have experienced sexual abuse. You can call them for support and guidance. The number is 06453 784926. Remember, you are not alone in this, Jauhar.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Azize, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Adin. I'm 11 years old and I'm calling from Mkinga, Tanga. Nice to meet you, Adin. How can I assist you today? I think I need help. I overheard some people in my village talking about girls being taken away to work in the city, but they never come back. That sounds really concerning, Adin. It's important for us to address issues like this. It sounds like you might be talking about human trafficking. Yes, that's what I heard. They mentioned something about girls being forced to do things they don't want to do. It's really brave of you to speak up about this, Adin. Human trafficking, especially sex trafficking, is a serious issue that we need to address. Can you provide me with more details about what you heard? They were saying that the girls are promised jobs in the city, but then they end up being forced into doing bad things. They said some of the girls are as young as me. I'm so sorry to hear that, Adin. It's not right for anyone, especially children, to be put in those situations. We will do everything we can to help. Can you tell me if you know who is involved in this trafficking? I didn't hear any names, but I can try to find out more information and let you know. That would be very helpful, Adin. Thank you for being brave and reaching out to us. Your safety and well-being are our top priority. We will make sure to follow up on this information and take the necessary steps to protect those who are at risk.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Tumaini. How can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Aisha. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Mbulu, Manyara. Hello Aisha, how can I help you? I think I need help. I've been working as a domestic worker for a family in my village, but they make me work long hours and don't pay me properly. I'm sorry to hear that, Aisha. It sounds like you may be experiencing child labor and exploitation. Can you tell me more about your situation? Yes, I have to wake up early in the morning to clean the house, cook, and take care of their children. I work late into the night and sometimes they don't give me enough food to eat. That sounds very difficult, Aisha. No child should have to go through that. Do you have anyone you can talk to about this? No, I don't have anyone to talk to. I saw a poster about the child helpline at the bus stand and decided to call for help. I'm glad you reached out to us, Aisha. We take child labor and exploitation very seriously. We will do everything we can to help you. Can you tell me more about the family you work for? They are a wealthy family in my village. They promised my parents that they would take care of me and send me to school, but they haven't kept their word. Thank you for sharing that with me, Aisha. We will investigate this situation and ensure that you are safe and protected. It's important that you know you are not alone in this. We are here to support you. Thank you, Tumaini. I feel relieved knowing that someone is listening to me. You're welcome, Aisha. We will do everything we can to help you. Stay strong, and we will be in touch with you soon. Take care.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Mwanangwa, I'm 10 years old and I'm calling from Nyasa, Ruvuma. Hello Mwanangwa, I'm Seghen from the child helpline. What seems to be the problem? Well, I don't know what to do. My father has been drinking a lot lately and it's making our family life really difficult. I'm sorry to hear that, Mwanangwa. Substance abuse in the family can have a big impact. How has it been affecting you? My father gets angry and yells a lot when he drinks. He sometimes even becomes violent towards my mom and me. It's scary and I don't know how to make it stop. It's understandable that you're feeling scared and overwhelmed. It's important to talk about these things and get help. Have you tried talking to anyone else about this, like a teacher or a neighbor? No, I haven't. I didn't know who to talk to. But I heard about the child helpline and decided to call. I'm glad you reached out, Mwanangwa. You're very brave for doing so. It's important to remember that you're not alone in this. We can help you figure out a plan to keep yourself safe. Is there a trusted adult you can talk to about what's been happening at home? I think I can talk to my teacher about it. She's always been kind to me and I feel like she could help. That sounds like a good idea, Mwanangwa. Your teacher can provide support and help you find resources to deal with the situation. Remember, you deserve to feel safe and happy. If things get too difficult, you can always call us back. Is there anything else you'd like to talk about today? No, thank you, Seghen. I feel better now that I've talked to someone about this. Thank you for listening. You're welcome, Mwanangwa. Remember, help is always available. Take care of yourself and don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything. Goodbye. Goodbye, Seghen. Thank you.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Janeth, I'm 12 years old, and I live in Bukoba Vijijini, Kagera. Hello Janeth, my name is Faustina and I'm here to help you. What seems to be the problem? My older brother has been hitting me a lot lately. He gets angry for no reason and starts hitting me really hard. I'm sorry to hear that, Janeth. It's not okay for anyone to hurt you. Have you talked to your parents about this? I tried, but they don't believe me. They say it's just sibling fighting, but it's more than that. He's really hurting me. I understand, Janeth. It's important to speak up about abuse, even if it's coming from a family member. Have you thought about talking to a teacher or another adult you trust? I'm scared to tell anyone else. I don't want to get my brother in trouble, but I also don't want to keep getting hurt. It's brave of you to reach out for help, Janeth. You deserve to feel safe in your own home. We can help you find ways to stay safe and get the support you need. Would you like to talk more about it? Yes, please. I don't know what to do, and I'm tired of feeling scared all the time. You're not alone, Janeth. We're here to support you and help you through this. Let's talk about some ways to keep you safe and find a solution to stop the abuse.

Hello, how can I help you today? Hi there, I'm Mwakalinga. I'm 13 years old, and I'm calling from Rorya, Mara. Hello Mwakalinga, this is Zaina from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? I'm calling because I'm experiencing some issues at home. After my parents separated, my dad has been coming over to our house and causing trouble. He gets violent and starts yelling at my mom and me. I'm so sorry to hear that, Mwakalinga. It's important that you feel safe and supported in your own home. I understand how difficult this must be for you and your family. Have you thought about reaching out to a trusted adult or authority figure for help? I haven't, but I heard about the child helpline at the Community Center. That's why I decided to call. I'm glad you reached out, Mwakalinga. It's important that you feel safe and supported. We can help you navigate this challenging situation and connect you with the right resources. Thank you, Zaina. I just want things to get better at home and for my mom to feel safe again. You're very brave for speaking up, Mwakalinga. We'll do everything we can to support you and your family through this. Let's work together to find a solution to the domestic violence you're facing.

Hello, is this the child helpline? My name is Omar, I'm 33 years old and calling from Lindi Mjini, Lindi. Yes, this is Fernando from the child helpline. How can I assist you today, Omar? I'm calling about a child named Ajali, she is 12 years old and she lives here in Lindi. I'm concerned because she has been skipping school a lot lately. Thank you for reaching out, Omar. Well, Ajali comes from a low-income family and her parents are struggling to provide for her. It's unfortunate that many children in similar situations are forced to drop out of school. As a community, we need to come together to support these children and ensure they have access to education. Exactly, Fernando. I believe that every child deserves the opportunity to receive an education and build a better future. Ajali is a bright young girl, and it would be a shame to see her potential go to waste. I agree, Omar. I will make sure to follow up on Ajali's case and connect her family with the necessary resources and support. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Thank you for your help, Fernando. I hope we can make a positive impact on Ajali's life and encourage her to stay in school. We will do our best to support Ajali and her family. If you have any more concerns or issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. Thank you, Omar. Thank you, Fernando. Goodbye. Goodbye, Omar.

Hi, um, is this the child helpline? Yes, this is Clara from the child helpline. How can I help you today? Hi Clara, I'm Digna. I'm 17 years old and I live in Ubungo, Dar es Salaam. Well, I've always struggled with social anxiety. I get really nervous around people, especially in large groups. It's been getting worse lately and I don't know how to handle it. I've tried deep breathing and positive self-talk, but it doesn't seem to help much. I just feel overwhelmed and scared all the time. It's brave of you to reach out for help, Digna. Have you thought about talking to a trusted adult or a professional about your anxiety? I haven't really talked to anyone about it. I feel like no one would understand what I'm going through. It's important to remember that you're not alone, Digna. We're here to listen and support you. Have you considered seeking therapy or counseling to help you work through your social anxiety? I haven't thought about that, but maybe it's worth a try. Thank you for listening, Clara. It feels good to talk about it. I'm glad you reached out, Digna. Remember, it's okay to ask for help when you need it. Take care of yourself and don't hesitate to call us again if you need to talk.

Hello, good afternoon. My name is Gaudencia, and I'm calling from Kalambo, Rukwa. I'm worried about a child named Hafsa who is 8 years old. I think she might be skipping school. Joel from the child helpline here. Thank you for reaching out, Gaudencia. Can you tell me more about what's been happening with Hafsa? Well, I've noticed that Hafsa has been missing school quite often lately. Her parents are always busy with work, so they may not be aware of what's going on. I'm concerned that she might be falling behind in her studies. I see. It's important to address this issue before it becomes a bigger problem. Have you tried talking to Hafsa's parents about this? Yes, I have, but they seem to be preoccupied with their work and don't have much time to focus on Hafsa's education. I'm not sure what to do next. It's understandable that Hafsa's parents may have other priorities, but education is crucial for a child's future. Have you thought about reaching out to the school or local authorities for support? I haven't thought of that. Maybe I could visit the school and speak to Hafsa's teachers to see if they have noticed any changes in her behavior or attendance. I could also go to the Town Hall and seek advice from the local authorities on how to address this issue. That sounds like a good plan, Gaudencia. It's important to work together to ensure that Hafsa receives the support she needs to stay in school and succeed academically. Thank you for caring about her well-being and taking action to help her.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Kombo. I'm 13 years old and I'm from Kigoma Mjini, Kigoma. Nice to meet you, Kombo. My name is Avelina, and I'm here to help.
