It's important to talk about your feelings and not keep them bottled up inside. Have you tried any relaxation techniques when you start feeling anxious? Not really. I usually just try to avoid situations that make me feel anxious. Avoiding situations might provide temporary relief, but it's important to learn how to cope with your anxiety in a healthy way. Have you thought about talking to a school counselor or a trusted adult about how you've been feeling? I haven't, but I think I might try talking to my teacher about it. Thank you for listening and giving me some advice, Josphat. You're welcome, Glory. Remember, it's okay to ask for help when you need it. Take care of yourself, okay? Thank you, I will. Goodbye.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Luciana speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Busu. I'm 10 years old and I'm calling from Kibaha, Pwani. Nice to meet you, Busu. What seems to be the problem? I ran away from home because my parents were fighting all the time. I couldn't take it anymore. I'm sorry to hear that, Busu. It must have been really tough for you. Are you safe now? Yes, I'm hiding near the Post Office in town. Okay, Busu. I'm glad to hear that you are safe. Can you tell me more about what happened at home? My parents argue all the time about money and I feel scared and sad. I just wanted to get away from all the fighting. I understand, Busu. It sounds like a difficult situation. Have you tried talking to anyone about how you feel? No, I didn't know who to talk to. I just wanted to run away. It's okay, Busu. You did the right thing by reaching out for help. We are here to listen and support you. Do you have a safe place to stay tonight? Not really. I'm scared to go back home. I can help you find a safe place to stay for tonight, Busu. And we can also talk about how we can help your family resolve their conflicts. Would you like that? Yes, please. I just want everything to be okay again. We will do our best to help you, Busu. You are not alone in this. Thank you for reaching out for help. Let's work together to make things better for you and your family.

Hi, um, hello there. Good afternoon, this is Jacqueline from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hi Jacqueline, my name is Jeremy, I'm 13 years old, and I'm calling from Magharibi Unguja, Mjini Magharibi. Nice to meet you, Jeremy. How can I help you today? Well, I'm really scared because my parents recently separated, and my dad has been coming to our house and getting violent with my mom. I'm so sorry to hear that, Jeremy. It's not okay for anyone to be violent towards another person. Domestic violence is a serious issue. Have you or your mom talked to anyone about this before? No, we haven't. I don't know who to talk to, and my mom is too scared to tell anyone. It's important to remember that you are not alone in this situation. It's brave of you to reach out for help. Have you or your mom considered contacting the authorities or seeking help from a trusted adult? We haven't, but I feel like we should do something. I'm really worried about my mom's safety. It's important to prioritize your safety and well-being. You can contact the police or seek help from a local organization that supports victims of domestic violence. You can also call the child helpline anytime at 07605 287189 for further assistance. Is there a mosque or any other landmark near your house that we can use as a reference point for help to reach you? Yes, there is a mosque near our house. Thank you for your help, Jacqueline. You're welcome, Jeremy. Remember, it's important to speak up and seek help when you or someone you know is in danger. Stay safe and take care.

Hello, is this the child helpline? Yes, this is Lucia from the child helpline. How can I help you today? My name is Mwashambwa, I'm 13 years old and I'm calling from Mvomero, Morogoro. I need some advice. Of course, Mwashambwa. What seems to be the problem? I've been feeling pressured by my friends to try smoking and drinking alcohol. They say it's cool and everyone is doing it. I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling pressured, Mwashambwa. It's important to remember that you have the right to say no to things that make you uncomfortable. I know, but it's hard when all my friends are doing it. I don't want to be left out. Peer pressure can be tough to deal with, but it's important to think about the consequences of giving in to it. Experimenting with substances can have serious health risks and legal consequences. I didn't really think about that. I just wanted to fit in with my friends. It's natural to want to feel accepted by your peers, but it's also important to make choices that are good for your health and well-being. Have you talked to anyone else about how you're feeling? No, I haven't. I didn't know who to turn to. I'm glad you reached out to us, Mwashambwa. Remember, you can always talk to a trusted adult like a teacher or family member about what you're going through. And if you ever feel overwhelmed, you can always call the child helpline for support. Thank you, Lucia. I feel better talking to you about this. I'll try to make better choices for myself. I'm glad I could help, Mwashambwa. Remember, you're not alone in this. Take care of yourself and don't hesitate to reach out if you need support in the future.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Alasiri, how can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Noel and I'm calling about a young boy named Andwele. He's 16 years old and he's from Bukoba Vijijini in Kagera. Of course, Noel. What seems to be the issue with Andwele? Well, he recently started his first relationship with a girl from his school. They seemed really happy at first, but now Andwele is feeling confused and upset. He doesn't know how to handle the challenges that come with being in a relationship. It's understandable that Andwele may be feeling overwhelmed. First relationships can be quite challenging. Can you tell me more about what specifically is troubling him? Andwele is struggling with communication issues with his girlfriend. They often misunderstand each other and end up arguing. He doesn't know how to express his feelings and fears that he might lose her if things don't improve. It sounds like Andwele could benefit from learning healthy communication skills in relationships. It's important for him to express his feelings openly and honestly with his girlfriend. Have you talked to him about seeking advice or guidance on how to improve their communication? Yes, I have, but Andwele is quite shy and finds it hard to open up to others. He's afraid of being judged or rejected. I just want to help him navigate through this difficult time. I appreciate your concern for Andwele, Noel. It's important for him to know that he can reach out for support and guidance. I can provide you with some resources and tips on how to improve communication in relationships. Andwele is not alone in facing these challenges, and we are here to help him through it.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Edda speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Idi, I am 15 years old and I'm calling from Mpanda, Rukwa. I have been having some trouble with my school work lately. What kind of trouble are you facing, Idi? I just can't seem to understand things as quickly as my classmates. It takes me longer to process information and sometimes I feel like I'm falling behind. I'm sorry to hear that, Idi. It must be really frustrating for you. Have you talked to your teachers or parents about this? Yes, I have spoken to my teachers but they don't seem to understand. They just tell me to work harder and pay more attention in class. It sounds like you are really struggling with your learning difficulties. Have you ever been tested for any learning disabilities? No, I haven't been tested. I didn't even know that was a possibility. Do you think that could be the reason for my struggles? It's possible, Idi. I would recommend speaking to your parents about getting tested for any learning disabilities. It's important to get the right support and accommodations in place to help you succeed in school. Thank you, Edda. I will talk to my parents about getting tested. I really appreciate your help and advice. You're welcome, Idi. Remember, it's okay to ask for help and to seek support when you need it. You can always call us back if you need further assistance. Take care and good luck with everything. Thank you, Edda. Goodbye.

Hello, is this the child helpline? I really need someone to talk to. Yes, this is Mfalme from the child helpline. How can I help you today? My name is Nelly, I'm 12 years old, and I'm calling from Mkoani, Kusini Pemba. I'm having some trouble with my first relationship. I'm sorry to hear that, Nelly. Can you tell me more about what's been going on? Well, I recently started dating this boy from my school, but things have been getting really complicated. We used to have so much fun together, but now he's always ignoring me or hanging out with his other friends instead. It sounds like you're feeling hurt and confused by his behavior. Have you tried talking to him about how you're feeling? I've tried, but every time I bring it up, he just brushes it off or changes the subject. I don't know what to do. It's important to communicate openly and honestly in a relationship. Maybe you could try talking to him again and expressing how his actions are making you feel. I'm just scared that if I keep bringing it up, he'll break up with me and I'll be all alone. What should I do? Remember, it's important to prioritize your own feelings and well-being in a relationship. If he truly cares about you, he will listen to your concerns and work towards finding a solution together. If you're still feeling unsure, you can always seek advice from a trusted adult or counselor. There's also a police station near you where you can find help if needed. Thank you, Mfalme. I feel a little better talking about this with you. I'll try to have a conversation with him again and see how it goes. I'm glad I could help, Nelly. Remember, you deserve to be in a healthy and supportive relationship. Don't hesitate to reach out to us again if you need further assistance. Take care.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Sabas, how can I help you today? Hi Sabas, my name is Irene. I'm 15 years old and I'm from Mpwapwa, Dodoma. I have some questions about puberty and development. Of course, Irene. I'm here to help. What specifically would you like to know about puberty and development? Well, I've noticed some changes in my body recently and I'm not sure if they're normal. I feel like my breasts are growing and I'm starting to get my period. Is this normal for someone my age? Yes, Irene. Those are completely normal changes that happen during puberty. It's a natural part of growing up. It's important to remember that everyone goes through puberty at their own pace, so it's normal for these changes to happen at different times for different people. I see. I've also been feeling a bit confused about my feelings towards boys. Is this also a part of puberty? Absolutely, Irene. During puberty, you may start to have new feelings and attractions towards others. It's completely normal to have these feelings and it's important to talk to someone you trust about them. If you ever feel uncomfortable or unsure about anything, don't hesitate to reach out for support. Thank you, Sabas. I feel much better now knowing that these changes are normal. Is there anything else I should know about puberty and development? Just remember to take care of yourself, Irene. Eat well, exercise, and always practice good hygiene. And if you have any more questions or concerns, don't hesitate to call us again. We're here to help you.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Mwinyimkuu speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Kafil, I'm 17 years old and I'm calling from Kalambo, Rukwa. Nice to meet you, Kafil. What seems to be the issue today? Well, I've been making prank calls to the helpline and I feel really bad about it now. I see. Can you tell me more about why you've been making these prank calls? I don't know, I guess I was just feeling bored and wanted some attention. It's normal to feel that way sometimes, Kafil. But there are other ways to seek attention that aren't harmful. Have you talked to anyone about how you're feeling? Not really. I don't have many friends here in Kalambo. I understand. It's important to find healthy ways to express your feelings and get the attention you need. Have you thought about joining any clubs or activities in your community? I haven't really thought about it. But maybe I could look into it. That's a good idea, Kafil. It's important to find positive outlets for your energy and emotions. And remember, the helpline is here for you if you ever need someone to talk to in the future. Thank you, Mwinyimkuu. I really appreciate your help and guidance. You're welcome, Kafil. Take care of yourself, and don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything. Oh, and by the way, I hope you have a good view of the mosque from where you are in Kalambo. Thank you, I do. It's a beautiful sight to see every day. Goodbye, Mwinyimkuu.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Dionisia speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Dionisia, my name is Mwashambwa. I'm a 15-year-old boy from Chake Chake, Kusini Pemba. I'm calling because I have a problem with school. I'm sorry to hear that, Mwashambwa. Can you tell me more about what's going on? Well, you see, I have been missing a lot of school lately. My family is struggling financially, and my parents can't afford to pay for my school fees anymore. I have to help out with odd jobs to make ends meet. It must be really tough for you to have to deal with that at such a young age. Have you talked to your teachers or school counselors about your situation? Yes, I have tried to explain to them, but they don't seem to understand. They keep pressuring me to come to school regularly, but it's hard when my family needs my help to put food on the table. I understand, Mwashambwa. It's important for you to prioritize your family's needs, but education is also crucial for your future. Have you thought about any alternative solutions, like scholarships or financial assistance programs? I have looked into some options, but it's not easy to find help in our community. The nearest mosque has a charity program, but they can only provide limited support. It sounds like you're in a tough situation, Mwashambwa. I can help you explore more options and resources that may be available to you. Remember, you're not alone in this, and there are people who care about your well-being.

Hi, is this the child helpline? I need help. Hello, this is Ajabu from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? My name is Yohana, I'm 12 years old, and I'm calling from Namtumbo, Ruvuma. Nice to meet you, Yohana. What seems to be the problem? I've been experiencing a lot of verbal aggression at home. My parents constantly yell at me and say hurtful things. I'm sorry to hear that, Yohana. Verbal aggression is a form of emotional abuse, and it's important to address it. How does it make you feel when your parents speak to you that way? It makes me feel sad and worthless. I don't know what to do anymore. It's not okay for anyone to make you feel that way, especially your parents. Have you tried talking to them about how their words affect you? I've tried, but they just get angrier and yell even more. I feel like I have no one to turn to. You're not alone, Yohana. We're here to support you. It's important to remember that you deserve to be treated with respect and kindness. Have you considered talking to a teacher or counselor at your school about what's been happening? I haven't, but maybe that's a good idea. I go to Namtumbo Primary School, so maybe I can speak to my teacher there. That sounds like a good plan, Yohana. Remember, you have the right to feel safe and secure. If you ever need to talk again, don't hesitate to reach out to us. You deserve to be heard and supported.

Hello, child helpline. This is Ramadhani speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Eunice. I'm 12 years old and I'm from Gairo, Morogoro. Hello, Eunice. How are you feeling today? I'm not doing so great, Ramadhani. I'm having some trouble with my friends. I'm sorry to hear that, Eunice. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, we used to be a really close group of friends. We would always hang out together after school and on weekends. But lately, things have been different. They've started excluding me from activities and not inviting me to hang out with them anymore. That must be really tough, Eunice. Have you tried talking to your friends about how you're feeling? I did try, but they just brushed it off and said I was overreacting. It's been really lonely without them, and I don't know what I did wrong. It sounds like you're going through a difficult time, Eunice. It's important to remember that friendships can change as we grow older. Have you thought about making new friends or joining different activities? I haven't really thought about that. I guess I've been so focused on trying to fix things with my old friends that I didn't consider looking for new ones. It's okay to feel hurt and disappointed, Eunice. But remember, it's important to surround yourself with people who make you feel happy and supported. Maybe you can start by exploring new interests or hobbies to meet new friends. Thank you, Ramadhani. I'll try to keep that in mind and see if I can find a new group of friends to hang out with. You're welcome, Eunice. Remember, the child helpline is always here for you if you need someone to talk to. Don't hesitate to reach out if you need further support. Take care.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Jema speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Hawa, I am 10 years old, and I am calling from Tandahimba in Mtwara. Hello Hawa, nice to meet you. What seems to be troubling you today? I am really worried about my family. My older brother has been using drugs and it's causing a lot of problems at home. I'm so sorry to hear that, Hawa. Substance abuse can have a big impact on families. How has it been affecting you? It's been really hard. My brother is always angry and he yells a lot. He doesn't take care of himself or help around the house. My parents are always fighting because of him. That sounds really tough, Hawa. You shouldn't have to go through this alone. Have you talked to anyone else about what's going on at home? No, I haven't. I didn't know who to talk to. But I saw the number for the child helpline and I thought maybe you could help. I'm glad you reached out, Hawa. It's important to talk about these things. You can always call us whenever you need to. Have you thought about talking to your parents or another trusted adult about your concerns? I'm scared to talk to my parents because I don't want to make things worse. But maybe I could talk to my teacher at school. That's a good idea, Hawa. Your teacher can help support you and maybe even help your family get the help they need. Remember, you're not alone in this. You can always call us at 06540 270724 if you need someone to talk to.

Hello, this is the child helpline, how may I assist you today? Hi there, my name is Jefferson, I'm 13 years old and I'm calling from Maswa, Shinyanga. Nice to meet you, Jefferson. I'm Cyrus, one of the counselors here at the child helpline. How can I help you? I'm calling because I recently got injured while playing soccer with my friends. I fell and hurt my arm pretty badly. I'm sorry to hear that, Jefferson. Can you tell me more about the injury? Have you seen a doctor or received any medical treatment? No, I haven't seen a doctor yet. My arm is swollen and I can't move it properly. It's been a few days now and the pain is getting worse. It sounds like you might need medical attention, Jefferson. Have you spoken to your parents or any other adult about this? Yes, I told my mom but she said we can't afford to go to the hospital. Is there any way you can help me? Of course, Jefferson. I can provide you with information on the nearest health facility, which in your case would be the District Hospital in Maswa. They can provide you with the necessary medical care for your injury. Thank you, Cyrus. I'll try to convince my mom to take me to the hospital. I really appreciate your help. You're welcome, Jefferson. Remember, your health is important and it's okay to ask for help when you need it. Don't hesitate to call us back if you have any more questions or concerns. Take care.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Zakia speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi Zakia, my name is Valentine. I'm a 26-year-old female calling about a child named Rach from Kibondo, Kigoma. Thank you for sharing that information, Valentine. So, what seems to be the issue with Rach? Rach has been showing signs of depression lately. She seems to be constantly sad and withdrawn, and I'm really worried about her well-being. I'm sorry to hear that, Valentine. It's important that we address Rach's mental health concerns. Can you tell me more about what might be causing her distress? Rach's parents passed away a few months ago, and she has been living with her aunt who is not very supportive. She is also struggling in school and has been facing bullying from her classmates. I see, that sounds like a lot for an 11-year-old to handle. It's understandable that Rach might be feeling overwhelmed and depressed. Have you tried talking to her about seeking help or counseling? Yes, I have tried to talk to her about it, but she is hesitant to open up. I think she really needs professional help to cope with everything she's going through. I agree, Valentine. It's important for Rach to have the support she needs to navigate through this challenging time. I can provide you with resources and guidance on how to access mental health services for Rach. Is there a landmark near your location, like the Police Station, where Rach can go for assistance? Yes, there is a Police Station nearby. I will make sure to guide Rach there so she can get the help she needs. Thank you for your support, Zakia. You're welcome, Valentine. Remember, you're doing a great job looking out for Rach's well-being. Don't hesitate to reach out to us if you need further assistance. Take care.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I assist you today? Hi there, my name is Amaziah, I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Kilolo, Iringa. Hello Amaziah, this is Edina from the child helpline. How can I help you? I was just wondering about the services you provide. I've heard about the helpline but I wanted to know more about it. Of course, I can give you some information about our helpline. We are here to provide support and assistance to children who are in need of help or guidance. We offer counseling, referrals to other services, and a safe space for you to talk about any issues you may be facing. That sounds really helpful. How do I know if I need to call the helpline? You can call us anytime you are feeling scared, alone, confused, or if you just need someone to talk to. We are here to listen and support you through any challenges you may be facing. Do you provide help for specific issues like abuse, bullying, or family problems? Yes, we can assist you with those issues and more. If you are experiencing abuse, bullying, or any other problem, we can provide you with resources and referrals to organizations that can help you. Your safety and well-being are our top priority. Thank you, Edina. I feel better knowing that I can reach out to the helpline if I ever need help. I'm glad I could provide you with the information you needed, Amaziah. Remember, you are not alone, and we are here to support you whenever you need us. Take care.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Kamili speaking. How can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Rozina. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Mjini Unguja, Mjini Magharibi. Nice to meet you, Rozina. How can I help you today? I'm having a problem with my school. They are denying me my right to education. I'm sorry to hear that, Rozina. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, the teachers at my school are not providing us with the necessary materials for learning. They don't have enough textbooks, and sometimes we don't even have enough desks to sit on. That sounds like a serious issue, Rozina. Every child has the right to a quality education. Have you tried talking to anyone at the school about this? Yes, I have tried talking to my teachers, but they just ignore me. I don't know what else to do. Don't worry, Rozina. You did the right thing by reaching out to us. We will make sure to escalate this issue and get the necessary authorities involved to ensure your right to education is respected. Thank you so much, Kamili. I really appreciate your help. It's our job to make sure that children like you are safe and have access to their rights. We will do everything we can to help you, Rozina. Just remember, you are not alone in this. Thank you, Kamili. I feel much better knowing that someone is listening to me. You're welcome, Rozina. Take care and stay strong. We will do our best to resolve this issue for you.

Hello? Good afternoon, this is Mwakanjuki from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Nen. I'm eleven years old and I'm from Wete, Kaskazini Pemba. I wanted to inquire about the helpline. Of course, Nen. What specifically would you like to know about the helpline? Well, I heard about the helpline from a friend at school, and I wanted to know how it works. Like, if I need help, how do I contact you guys and what kind of support can I expect? That's a great question, Nen. The child helpline is a confidential service where children like you can reach out for support, guidance, or assistance. You can contact us through our toll-free number or even through text message. Our counselors are trained to listen to your concerns and provide you with the help you may need. Whether it's about bullying, abuse, or any other issue you're facing, we're here to help. That's really helpful to know. Thank you, Mwakanjuki. Also, is there a physical location for the helpline where I can visit if needed? Yes, Nen. We have a physical location at the Town Hall in Wete where you can come and speak to a counselor in person if you prefer that. Just ask for the child helpline office, and someone will assist you. That's good to know. Thank you for all the information, Mwakanjuki. I feel more confident now knowing that I have someone to turn to if I ever need help. You're welcome, Nen. Remember, we're here for you whenever you need us. Take care, and don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything.

Hi, um, hello there. Good afternoon, this is Christopher from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hi Christopher, my name is Helena, I'm 16 years old and I live in Monduli, Arusha. Nice to meet you, Helena. What seems to be troubling you today? Well, I've been feeling a lot of pressure from my friends to engage in risky behavior lately, especially when it comes to sexual activities. I see, peer pressure can be really tough to handle. Can you tell me more about the situations you've been facing? Yeah, my friends have been pressuring me to go out with boys and do things that I'm not comfortable with. They make me feel like I'm not cool if I don't go along with them. It's important to remember that you should never feel pressured to do something that makes you uncomfortable, Helena. Your safety and well-being should always come first. I know, but it's hard to stand up to them sometimes. I don't want to lose my friends, but I also don't want to put myself in risky situations. I understand how difficult this must be for you. It's important to surround yourself with friends who respect your boundaries and support your decisions. Have you thought about talking to an adult you trust about what you're going through? Not really, I've been too scared to bring it up. But I guess it's worth a try. Talking to a trusted adult can provide you with the guidance and support you need to navigate these challenging situations, Helena. Remember, you're not alone in this. We're here to help you every step of the way. Thank you, Christopher. I feel a bit better already knowing that I have someone to talk to about this.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Hadithi, I'm 13 years old and I'm from Masasi, Mtwara. Hello Hadithi, I'm Hawa from the child helpline. How can I assist you? I have a problem, my friends are always talking about running away from home. That sounds concerning, Hadithi. Can you tell me more about what's going on? They say that it's fun to run away and be free from rules at home. Have you ever thought about running away yourself, Hadithi? Well, sometimes I feel like it would be nice to be free from all the chores and responsibilities. It's normal to feel that way sometimes, but running away is not a safe solution. Have you talked to your parents about how you're feeling? No, I haven't. I'm scared they'll get mad at me for even thinking about it. I understand your fear, but your parents care about you and want to help. Running away can be dangerous, and it's important to communicate with your family. I don't want to disappoint them, but my friends make it sound like a great adventure. It's important to remember that everyone's situation is different. It's okay to feel frustrated, but running away is not the answer. We can work together to find other ways to cope with your feelings. Okay, I'll try talking to my parents about how I'm feeling. Thank you for listening, Hawa. You're welcome, Hadithi. Remember, we're here to support you whenever you need us. Take care of yourself.

Hello, is this the child helpline? Yes, this is Andalwisye from the child helpline. How can I help you today? My name is Kito, I am 16 years old and I am calling from Malinyi, Morogoro. Nice to meet you, Kito. What seems to be the problem? Well, I have been skipping school a lot lately and I don't know what to do. I feel like I am falling behind and I don't have anyone to talk to about it. I'm glad you reached out to us, Kito. It's important to address these issues before they escalate. Can you tell me why you have been skipping school? It's just really hard for me to focus in class. I feel like the teachers don't really care about me and I don't see the point in going. I understand how you feel, Kito. It's important to remember that your education is valuable and can open up many opportunities for you in the future. Have you tried talking to your teachers or school counselor about how you are feeling? No, I haven't. I don't feel comfortable talking to them about it. That's okay, Kito. We can work together to find a solution. Would you be open to exploring other options, such as tutoring or counseling, to help you get back on track with your education? Yes, that sounds like it could help. Thank you for listening to me and offering support. Of course, Kito. We are here to help you. Remember, you are not alone in this. Feel free to reach out to us anytime you need someone to talk to.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Clara, how can I assist you today? Hi Clara, my name is Fatma. I'm calling about my daughter Alasiri. She's 14 years old and we live in Sikonge, Tabora. I'm really worried about her. Hello Fatma, nice to meet you. What seems to be the issue with Alasiri? She's been very anxious and stressed lately. She's always been a bit shy, but now it's affecting her daily life. She doesn't want to go to school or socialize with her friends. I'm sorry to hear that. It sounds like she may be dealing with social anxiety. Have you noticed any specific triggers or events that may have caused this increase in anxiety? Well, she's always been a bit reserved, but recently she had a falling out with her best friend. Ever since then, she's been even more withdrawn and reluctant to engage with others. I see. It's understandable that such a situation could have a big impact on her. Have you tried talking to her about her feelings and concerns? Yes, I've tried to talk to her and reassure her, but she just shuts down and doesn't want to discuss it. I want to help her, but I'm not sure how to approach the situation. It's great that you're reaching out for help. It's important to create a safe and supportive environment for her to express her feelings. Would you like some guidance on how to help Alasiri manage her anxiety and build her confidence? Yes, that would be helpful. I just want to see her happy and healthy again. Thank you for your support, Clara.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Idi speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Idi, my name is Dora and I'm 16 years old. I'm calling from Bahi, Dodoma. Nice to meet you, Dora. How can I assist you today? I wanted to talk about child labor. I've been working at a local farm for long hours, and I feel like it's exploitative employment. I'm sorry to hear that, Dora. Can you tell me more about your situation? Well, I have been working at the farm since I was 14, helping with planting and harvesting crops. I work long hours every day and I'm not paid fairly for my work. That does sound concerning, Dora. Child labor is a serious issue and it's important that your rights are protected. Have you spoken to anyone about this situation? No, I haven't. I didn't know who to turn to for help. You did the right thing by reaching out to us, Dora. We can help you navigate this situation and ensure that your rights are protected. Have you faced any form of abuse or exploitation at the farm? Yes, sometimes the farm owner yells at me and other children working there. I feel scared and overwhelmed. I understand, Dora. Your safety and well-being are our top priorities. We will take action to address this situation and ensure that you are protected. Can you provide me with the phone number of the farm owner so we can follow up on this issue? Sure, the phone number is +255 7493 694556. Thank you, Dora. We will investigate this matter further and take the necessary steps to ensure your safety and well-being. Remember, you have the right to a safe and fair working environment.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Naima, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Milka. I'm 10 years old and I live in Tarime, Mara. Nice to meet you, Milka. What can I assist you with today? I'm having a problem with my school. They are denying me my right to education. I'm sorry to hear that, Milka. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, my teacher keeps sending me home because my parents haven't paid my school fees. But it's not my fault that they can't afford it. I see, that must be really frustrating for you. Every child has the right to education, regardless of their family's financial situation. Yes, that's what I thought too. I really want to go to school and learn, but I feel like I'm being punished for something that's out of my control. I understand, Milka. It's important for you to know that this is not right. Your school should not be denying you your right to education because of unpaid fees. But what can I do about it? My parents have tried talking to the school, but they won't listen. Don't worry, Milka. We can help you with this. I will make sure to contact the relevant authorities and advocate for your right to education. Is there a landmark near your home that I can use as a reference point? Yes, there is a Post Office near my house. Thank you, Milka. I will follow up on this issue and make sure that your educational rights are protected. You deserve to go to school and learn just like every other child.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Zena. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Kakonko, Kigoma. Hello Zena, I'm Edda from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Ndweleifwa, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Fatma. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Kigoma Vijijini in Kigoma. Hello, how may I help you today? Hi, I'm Angolwisye, I'm 11 years old and I'm calling from Micheweni, Kaskazini Pemba. Hello Angolwisye, my name is Faustina and I'm here to help you. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Jauhar speaking, how can I assist you today? Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Saidi speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Saidi, my name is Marwa and I'm 16 years old. I'm from Mkuranga, Pwani. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Ajabu, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Neema. I'm 16 years old and I'm calling from Kiteto, Manyara. Hello, Child Helpline, this is Valentine speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Restituta. I'm 11 years old, a girl, and I'm calling from Magharibi Unguja, Mjini Magharibi. Hello, Child Helpline, Fabian speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Nen, I'm 11 years old, and I'm calling from Bagamoyo in Pwani. Nice to meet you, Nen. What seems to be the problem? Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Jauhar speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Doreen. I'm 12 years old and I live in Morogoro Vijijini, Morogoro. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Ishara, how can I help you today? Hi Ishara, my name is Amri. I'm 15 years old and I'm calling from Tarime, Mara. Hello, Child Helpline, how can I assist you today? Hi there, my name is Johnson, I'm 14 years old, and I'm calling from Ileje, Mbeya. Nice to meet you, Johnson. Hello, um, hi there. Good afternoon, this is Kami from the child helpline. How can I help you today? Hi Kami, my name is Cornelius. I'm 17 years old and I'm calling from Missenyi, Kagera. Hello, Child Helpline, this is Constantine speaking. How can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Clara. I'm 12 years old and I'm calling from Newala, Mtwara. Nice to meet you, Clara. Remember, you're not alone, and we're here to support you.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Katalina speaking, how can I assist you today? Hello, my name is Agnes. I'm 43 years old and I'm calling about my son, Joshua. I can provide you with information on local youth groups or organizations that Joshua can join. There's also a community center near the District Hospital that offers programs for teenagers. That would be great, Katalina. Thank you for your help. I'll make sure to talk to Joshua about these options. Thank you for listening to my concerns. You're welcome, Agnes. Hello, Child Helpline, this is Elina speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Suzana. I'm 11 years old and I live in Kibaha, Pwani. Hello Suzana, nice to meet you. It's important to remember that you deserve friends who treat you with kindness and respect. Have you thought about talking to a teacher or school counselor about what's been happening? I haven't, but maybe that's a good idea. I just feel so lonely and left out all the time. It's okay to feel that way, Suzana. Remember, it's not your fault if your friends are behaving in a hurtful manner. You deserve to be surrounded by people who value and appreciate you for who you are. Thank you, Elina. I feel a bit better talking about it. I think I will talk to a teacher tomorrow and see if they can help me. I'm glad to hear that, Suzana. Remember, you can always call us at the child helpline if you need someone to talk to. You're not alone in this. Thank you for listening, Elina. It means a lot to me. You're welcome, Suzana. Take care of yourself and remember that you deserve to have friends who make you feel happy and supported. Goodbye.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Mwinyimkuu speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Adelina, I am 15 years old, and I am calling from Ileje in Mbeya. I have been feeling really unwell lately, and I'm not sure what to do. I'm sorry to hear that, Adelina. Can you tell me more about what you've been experiencing? Well, I have been having constant stomach pains and headaches for the past few weeks. I also feel very tired all the time, no matter how much I rest. That sounds concerning, Adelina. Have you seen a doctor about these symptoms? No, I haven't been able to. My family doesn't have much money, and we live far from the nearest health center. The only way to get there is by crossing the river bridge, and it's been flooded due to the heavy rains. I understand the challenges you are facing, Adelina. It must be difficult to not have access to proper healthcare. Have you tried any home remedies or talked to anyone in your community about your symptoms? Yes, I have tried some traditional remedies, but they haven't helped much. I haven't talked to anyone in my community because I'm worried they might not take me seriously. It's important to take your health concerns seriously, Adelina. I can provide you with information on mobile health clinics that may be able to visit your area, or I can help you find alternative ways to access healthcare. Your health is important, and you deserve to feel better.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Dorica speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Aida, I'm 13 years old, and I'm calling from Iramba, Singida. I'm feeling really upset because my parents are always arguing about money. It's starting to affect me a lot. I'm sorry to hear that, Aida. It must be tough to see your parents fighting all the time. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, my dad lost his job a few months ago, and ever since then, things have been really tense at home. My parents argue almost every day about bills, groceries, and how to make ends meet. I can hear them shouting at each other, and it makes me feel scared and anxious. It sounds like a really challenging situation for you, Aida. It's understandable that you would feel worried and stressed out. Have you tried talking to your parents about how their fighting is affecting you? I've tried to tell them that it upsets me when they argue, but they just brush it off and say that it's none of my business. I feel like they don't understand how much their conflicts are hurting me. I'm so sorry to hear that, Aida. It's important for children to feel safe and supported at home, especially during difficult times. Have you thought about reaching out to a trusted adult, like a teacher or relative, for help and support? I haven't really talked to anyone else about this. I didn't know who to turn to until I found out about the child helpline. I just needed someone to talk to who might understand what I'm going through. I'm glad you reached out to us, Aida. You are not alone, and we are here to listen and support you through this tough time. Would you like to explore some coping strategies or discuss how to have a conversation with your parents about how you're feeling? Yes, that would be really helpful. Thank you for listening and for offering your support, Dorica. It means a lot to me.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Alasiri speaking, how can I help you today? Hi Alasiri, my name is Mwakamba and I'm 10 years old. I'm calling from Mpwapwa in Dodoma. Nice to meet you, Mwakamba. How can I assist you today? I'm feeling really pressured by my friends to do things I know are not right. I'm sorry to hear that, Mwakamba. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, my friends have been talking about doing risky things like sneaking out at night and meeting up with older kids. They even mentioned something about relationships and stuff. That sounds like a lot to deal with at your age. How do you feel about what they're suggesting? I'm not sure, Alasiri. I know it's not right, but I don't want to lose my friends by saying no. It's important to remember that true friends will respect your decisions and boundaries, Mwakamba. You have the right to say no to things that make you uncomfortable or put you at risk. But what if they start making fun of me or exclude me from our group? It can be tough to stand up to peer pressure, but your safety and well-being should always come first. Have you talked to anyone else about what's been going on? Not really. I didn't know who to turn to until I found this helpline number on a poster near Main Road. I'm glad you reached out to us, Mwakamba. You're not alone in this. We can work together to find ways to handle the situation and keep you safe.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Radhi, how can I assist you today? I'm Hawa, I'm 54 years old, and I'm calling about a child named Neema, she's 9 years old and she's from Mpanda, Rukwa. Oh, I see. What seems to be the issue with Neema? There's been some domestic violence going on in Neema's home. Her parents recently separated, but her father has been coming back to the house and causing trouble. He's been shouting, breaking things, and even hitting Neema and her mother. I'm so sorry to hear that Neema is going through such a difficult situation. It's important that we address this issue immediately. Is Neema safe at the moment? Yes, she's currently staying with her aunt, who lives nearby. They are scared to go back home because of her father's violent behavior. I understand. It's crucial that Neema and her mother are protected from any further harm. We can help connect them with resources and support services to ensure their safety. Is there a nearby landmark where they can meet us to discuss this further? Yes, there's a community center not far from their aunt's house. They can meet you there tomorrow afternoon. Thank you for providing that information, Hawa. I will make arrangements for a counselor to meet Neema and her mother at the community center tomorrow. In the meantime, please reassure them that help is on the way. Thank you so much for your assistance, Radhi. Neema and her mother really need help during this difficult time.

Hello, this is the Tanzania Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Cosmas. I'm 12 years old and I'm from Arumeru Magharibi in Arusha. Hello Cosmas, my name is Salma. How are you feeling today? I'm feeling really sad and overwhelmed. I've been having these thoughts...about hurting myself. I'm sorry to hear that, Cosmas. It's important that you reach out for help when you're feeling this way. Can you tell me more about what's been going on? I don't know, I just feel like everything is too much for me to handle. I feel like I'm a burden to my family and friends. It's okay to feel overwhelmed, Cosmas. But it's important to remember that you are not alone. We are here to support you. Have you ever acted on these thoughts of hurting yourself? No, but sometimes I feel like I want to just to make the pain go away. I'm glad you haven't acted on those thoughts, Cosmas. It's important to talk about how you're feeling instead of keeping it inside. Have you talked to anyone about these thoughts before? No, I haven't. I didn't know who to talk to. I'm glad you reached out to us, Cosmas. We can help you work through these feelings together. Would you like me to help you find someone to talk to in your community, like a counselor or a trusted adult? Yes, please. I don't want to feel this way anymore. I'm here for you, Cosmas. We will find the help you need to feel better. Remember, you are important and you deserve to feel safe and supported.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Jonathan. How can I help you today? Hi Jonathan, my name is Bahari and I'm a 13-year-old boy from Babati, Manyara. I'm calling because I don't know what to do. Hey Bahari, it's good to hear from you. What's going on? Well, I lost my parents a few years ago and I've been staying with my aunt since then. But now she says she can't take care of me anymore and wants me to leave. I'm so sorry to hear that, Bahari. It must be really tough for you right now. Have you talked to anyone else about this? No, I haven't. I don't have anyone else to turn to. I don't want to end up on the streets. I understand how scary that must be. It's important for you to know that there are people who can help you. There are resources available for children in situations like yours. Have you heard of shelters or organizations that help orphaned or abandoned children? I've heard of them, but I don't know how to reach out to them. I don't even know where to start. Don't worry, Bahari. I can help you with that. There are organizations that provide assistance and support for children in your situation. I can help you find a safe place to stay and connect you with people who can help you figure out your next steps. You're not alone in this. Thank you, Jonathan. I really appreciate your help. I was feeling so lost and hopeless, but now I feel like there might be a way out of this situation. I'm glad to hear that, Bahari. You deserve to feel safe and supported. Let's work together to find the help you need.

Hello, um, hi there. Good afternoon, this is Clement from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Conrad. I'm 13 years old and I live in Kinondoni, Dar es Salaam. Nice to meet you, Conrad. How can I help you today? Well, I've been having some problems at home. My parents have been fighting a lot lately, especially about money. I'm sorry to hear that, Conrad. It must be really tough for you. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Yeah, it's been really stressful. My dad lost his job a few months ago, and now there's a lot of tension in the house. My parents argue all the time, and it's starting to affect me too. I can imagine how difficult that must be for you, Conrad. It's important to remember that it's not your fault. Have you tried talking to your parents about how you feel? I've tried, but they just tell me not to worry about it. But it's hard not to when they're always yelling at each other. It's understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Have you thought about reaching out to a trusted adult or family member for support? I haven't really talked to anyone about it. I didn't know who to turn to. You did the right thing by calling us, Conrad. We're here to listen and support you through this difficult time. Is there anything else you'd like to share? Thank you, Clement. I feel a bit better just talking about it. I'll try to talk to my parents again and see if we can work things out. That's a great step, Conrad. Remember, you're not alone in this. Feel free to call us anytime you need someone to talk to. Take care of yourself, okay? Thank you, Clement. I will. Goodbye.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Lydia speaking. How can I help you today? Hi Lydia, my name is Collins. I'm a 10-year-old boy from Sumbawanga Mjini, Rukwa. I'm having a problem with bullying at school. I'm sorry to hear that, Collins. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? Well, there's this group of older boys in my class who always pick on me during academic competitions. They call me names and laugh at me when I make a mistake. It makes me feel really bad and I don't want to participate in any more competitions. I understand how that must be difficult for you, Collins. No one deserves to be treated that way. Have you tried talking to your teacher or a trusted adult about what's been happening? I haven't, because I'm afraid they might not take me seriously or think I'm just overreacting. It's important to speak up about bullying, Collins. You have the right to feel safe and respected at school. If you're comfortable, you can also try talking to your parents about what's been happening so they can support you. Okay, I will try talking to my parents about it. Thank you for listening and giving me advice, Lydia. You're welcome, Collins. Remember, you can always call the Child Helpline at 06163 788699 if you need further support. Take care of yourself, and don't hesitate to reach out if you need help in the future. Oh, and by the way, if you ever need to meet someone from the helpline, we are located near the Bus Stand in Sumbawanga Mjini.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Asukile, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Elly. I'm 15 years old and I'm calling from Kati Unguja, near the Mosque in Kusini Unguja. I'm having some problems at home. What seems to be the issue, Elly? I feel like I'm being neglected, especially when it comes to my education. My parents don't seem to care about my schoolwork or my future. I'm sorry to hear that, Elly. Education is very important. Have you tried talking to your parents about how you feel? Yes, I've tried, but they just brush me off and tell me to focus on helping out at home instead of studying. That must be really frustrating for you. Have you spoken to anyone else about this issue? No, I haven't. I didn't know who to turn to until I found this helpline number. I'm glad you reached out to us, Elly. Neglect, especially when it comes to education, is a serious issue. We can help you figure out a plan to address this situation. Have you thought about talking to a teacher or a school counselor about what's going on at home? I haven't, but I think that might be a good idea. I'll try talking to my teacher tomorrow. That's a good first step, Elly. Remember, you have the right to a proper education and support from your family. Don't hesitate to reach out to us again if you need further assistance.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Franklin, how can I help you today? Hi Franklin, my name is Calvin. I'm 17 years old and I'm calling from Newala, Mtwara. Nice to meet you, Calvin. What seems to be the problem today? I'm really scared and I don't know what to do. I think I'm being sexually exploited online. I'm so sorry to hear that, Calvin. Can you tell me more about what's been happening? I met someone online a few months ago and we started chatting. At first, it was just friendly, but then they started asking me to send them inappropriate photos. That sounds really concerning, Calvin. Have you sent them any photos? No, I haven't. But they keep pressuring me and threatening to share my personal information if I don't do what they say. It's important that you don't give in to their demands, Calvin. You've done the right thing by reaching out for help. We can help you report this and get the support you need. But I'm scared that they'll follow through with their threats. What if they do something to hurt me? Your safety is our top priority, Calvin. We can help you take steps to protect yourself and ensure that this person is held accountable for their actions. Can you tell me more about your online interactions with them? I've been talking to them on social media and they know a lot about me. I don't know what to do. Don't worry, Calvin. We will work together to figure out the best course of action. Let's start by documenting everything that has happened and then we can discuss next steps to keep you safe.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Violet speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Theresia, I'm 17 years old, and I'm from Tarime, Mara. I've been feeling really anxious lately and I don't know what to do about it. It's nice to meet you, Theresia. Can you tell me more about what's been making you feel anxious? I just started school again after being away for a while due to the pandemic, and I'm having a hard time being away from my family. I keep worrying about them and I feel like something bad might happen when I'm not around. It sounds like you might be experiencing separation anxiety, Theresia. It's perfectly normal to feel this way, especially after being apart from your family for some time. Have you talked to anyone about how you're feeling? No, I haven't really told anyone about it. I didn't think it was a big deal, but it's been getting harder to concentrate on my schoolwork because of these anxious feelings. It's important to remember that it's okay to feel this way, Theresia. It's normal to miss your family and worry about them. Have you tried any techniques to help you relax when you start feeling anxious? No, I haven't really tried anything. Do you have any suggestions on what I can do to help manage my anxiety? One technique you can try is deep breathing exercises. When you start feeling anxious, take slow, deep breaths to help calm your mind and body. You can also try talking to a trusted friend or family member about how you're feeling. It's important to remember that you're not alone in this, Theresia. Thank you, Violet. I'll definitely try those techniques and talk to someone about how I'm feeling. It feels good to know that I can reach out to the child helpline for support.

Hello, Child helpline, this is Kelvin speaking. How can I help you today? Hi Kelvin, my name is Luciana. I'm 10 years old, and I'm calling from Magharibi Unguja, Mjini Magharibi. Nice to meet you, Luciana. What's on your mind today? I've been having a lot of trouble with my schoolwork lately. I just can't seem to understand what the teacher is saying, and I'm falling behind in class. I'm sorry to hear that, Luciana. It must be really frustrating. Have you talked to your teacher or parents about this? I tried talking to my teacher, but she just said I need to pay more attention in class. And my parents are always busy with work, so I don't want to bother them. It's important to let your parents know how you're feeling, Luciana. They might be able to help you get the support you need. Have you ever heard of learning disabilities? No, I haven't. What are learning disabilities? Learning disabilities are conditions that make it harder for some people to learn, even though they are just as smart as their peers. It's possible that you might have a learning disability that's making it difficult for you to keep up in school. Oh, I didn't know that was a thing. Do you think I should talk to someone about it? I think it would be a good idea, Luciana. Maybe you can ask your parents to take you to see a specialist who can help you figure out if you have a learning disability. There are also resources available at the Police Station that can provide support for children with learning difficulties. Thank you, Kelvin. I'll talk to my parents about it and see if we can get some help. I really appreciate your advice. You're welcome, Luciana. Remember, it's important to speak up when you're struggling. We're here to help you every step of the way.

Hello, good afternoon. How may I help you today? Hello, this is Mzee from Musoma Vijijini. I am calling about a young girl named Asma. Hello Mzee, I am Evelina from the child helpline. How old is Asma? Asma is 14 years old and she lives here in Musoma Vijijini, Mara. What seems to be the issue with Asma? Well, Asma and her family are facing some food insecurity. They are struggling to have enough food to eat every day. I see, that is a very concerning situation. Has Asma been able to attend school regularly? No, unfortunately, Asma has been missing school quite often because she is not getting enough nutrition at home. It must be very difficult for Asma and her family. Have they tried reaching out to any local organizations for support? Yes, they have tried, but they have not been able to receive much help. They live near St. Mary's Church, but resources are limited in the area. I understand the challenges they are facing. We can definitely connect Asma and her family with some resources and support. Is there a specific type of assistance they are in need of? I think they would greatly benefit from food donations or any programs that provide assistance with basic needs like food and nutrition. Thank you for reaching out, Mzee. We will do our best to support Asma and her family during this difficult time. Please stay in touch with us for updates on the assistance we can provide. Thank you, Evelina. I appreciate your help in this matter.

Hello, thank you for calling the child helpline. This is Daniel, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Bali, I'm 14 years old and I'm calling from Sumbawanga Mjini, Rukwa. Nice to meet you, Bali. What's on your mind today? I've been feeling really down lately, like everything is just too much to handle. I'm sorry to hear that, Bali. Can you tell me more about what's been going on? Well, my family recently moved to a new town, and I had to change schools. I miss my old friends and I'm having a hard time fitting in here. It's completely normal to feel that way when going through major life changes like moving to a new place. Have you talked to anyone about how you're feeling? Not really, I don't want my parents to worry about me. And I feel like my friends back home wouldn't understand. It's important to have someone to talk to about your feelings, Bali. Have you thought about reaching out to a counselor at your new school or a trusted adult? I haven't really thought about that. I just feel so alone and like no one understands what I'm going through. I'm here to listen, Bali. You're not alone. It's okay to feel overwhelmed by all these changes. It's important to take care of yourself and talk about your feelings. Would you like me to help you find resources in your area to support you through this difficult time? Yes, that would be really helpful. Thank you for listening, Daniel.

Hello, Child Helpline, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Yusra, I'm 14 years old, and I'm calling from Kishapu, Shinyanga. Hello Yusra, my name is Fahamu, and I'm here to listen and support you. What's on your mind today? I've been feeling really down lately, and I think I might be depressed. I'm sorry to hear that, Yusra. Depression is a serious issue, but it's important to talk about it. Can you tell me more about how you've been feeling? I just feel like nothing brings me joy anymore. I used to love playing soccer and spending time with my friends, but now it all feels pointless. I can't seem to shake off this sadness. I'm glad you reached out for help, Yusra. It's brave of you to acknowledge your feelings. Have you talked to anyone about how you're feeling? Not really. My family is always busy, and I don't want to burden them with my problems. It's important to remember that it's okay to ask for help, Yusra. Depression is a common mental health issue that many people face. Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or appetite? Yes, I've been having trouble sleeping, and I've lost my appetite. I just feel tired all the time. It sounds like you're going through a tough time, Yusra. It's important to know that depression can be caused by a combination of factors, including biological predisposition. Have you thought about seeking professional help? I haven't really considered it, but talking to you has made me feel a bit better. Thank you, Fahamu. I'm glad I could help, Yusra. Remember, you're not alone in this. We're here to support you. Don't hesitate to reach out again if you need someone to talk to.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Sanyu speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Imara. I'm 10 years old and I live in Kati Unguja, Kusini Unguja. Nice to meet you, Imara. What's on your mind today? I've been making prank calls to people and I feel really bad about it. I'm glad you reached out to us, Imara. It's important to recognize when our actions might be hurting others. Can you tell me more about why you've been making these prank calls? I don't know, I guess I just wanted attention. My friends were doing it too, and I wanted to join in. It's understandable to want to fit in with your friends, but it's important to remember that it's not okay to hurt or inconvenience others for attention. How do you feel after making these calls? I feel guilty and ashamed. I know it was wrong. It takes a lot of courage to admit when we've made a mistake, Imara. I'm proud of you for recognizing that. What do you think you can do to make things right? I want to apologize to the people I called and promise not to do it again. That's a great start, Imara. It's important to take responsibility for our actions and make amends. Is there anything else you'd like to talk about or any other support you need? No, I think I just needed someone to talk to about this. Thank you for listening, Sanyu. You're welcome, Imara. Remember, we're here to help whenever you need us. Take care.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Upendo. How can I help you today? Hey, my name is Jamil, I'm 17 years old and I'm calling from Simanjiro, Manyara. Hi Jamil, nice to meet you. What seems to be the problem? I'm in a really tough situation. There's been a lot of conflict in my village, and my family had to flee our home. Now we're displaced and living in a makeshift camp. I'm so sorry to hear that, Jamil. It must be incredibly difficult for you and your family. How are you feeling about everything? I feel scared and overwhelmed. I don't know what to do or where to go. I just want things to go back to normal. It's completely understandable to feel that way. You've been through a lot. Have you been able to talk to anyone about how you're feeling? Not really. I've been trying to stay strong for my family, but it's been hard to keep everything inside. It's important to talk about your feelings, Jamil. It's okay to not be okay. Have you thought about seeking support from any local organizations or services? I didn't know where to turn to, so I decided to call the child helpline. I just needed someone to talk to and help me figure out what to do next. I'm glad you reached out, Jamil. We're here to support you through this difficult time. We can connect you with resources and organizations that can help you and your family. You're not alone in this. Thank you, Upendo. I appreciate your support. It means a lot to know that there are people out there who care about me and my family.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Mama speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, Mama. My name is Andrea, I'm 17 years old, and I'm calling from Iringa Mjini, Iringa. I've been feeling really lonely and isolated lately. I'm sorry to hear that, Andrea. Loneliness can be really tough to deal with. Can you tell me more about why you're feeling this way? Well, I used to have a close group of friends, but they all moved away for school or work. Now I feel like I don't have anyone to talk to or hang out with. I just feel really left out and alone. That sounds really difficult, Andrea. It's important to remember that you're not alone in feeling this way. Many young people struggle with loneliness and isolation at some point. Have you tried reaching out to anyone for support? I haven't really talked to anyone about how I'm feeling. I guess I didn't want to bother anyone with my problems. It's important to remember that your feelings are valid, Andrea. It's okay to ask for help when you need it. Have you thought about joining any clubs or activities in your community to meet new people? I haven't really thought about that, but maybe I could try. Do you have any suggestions for places I could go to meet new friends? There are often community centers or youth groups in different neighborhoods where you can meet new people and make friends. You could also try volunteering or joining a sports team. Is there a community center or youth group near you that you could check out? There's a youth center near the Central Hospital that I've heard about. Maybe I could go there and see if I can meet some new people. Thank you for the suggestion, Mama. You're welcome, Andrea. Remember, you can always call us back if you need someone to talk to. And if you ever feel really overwhelmed, don't hesitate to reach out for help. Our phone number is 06135 775716. Take care of yourself, Andrea.

Hello, good afternoon. My name is Sanyu, and I am calling about a child named Fernando from Buhigwe, Kigoma. He is 11 years old and is facing some concerns related to puberty and development. Hi Sanyu, I'm Franklin from the child helpline. Thank you for reaching out to us about Fernando's issues. Can you tell me more about what he's going through? Well, Fernando has been asking a lot of questions about his changing body lately. He seems confused and worried about the changes he's experiencing as he grows older. It's great that Fernando feels comfortable enough to ask questions about puberty. It's a natural part of growing up, but it can be challenging for children to understand. Have you talked to him about these changes? I have tried to explain things to him, but I think he needs more guidance and support. I want to make sure he receives accurate information about puberty and development to ease his worries. That's understandable, Sanyu. It's important for children to have accurate information about puberty to help them navigate this stage of life. Would you like me to provide you with some resources or guidance on how to talk to Fernando about these changes? Yes, please. Any resources or advice on how to approach the topic with Fernando would be greatly appreciated. I want to ensure he has the correct information and feels supported during this time. Of course, Sanyu. I can provide you with some useful resources and guidance on addressing puberty and development concerns with Fernando. Let's work together to help him feel more confident and informed about the changes he's experiencing.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Bakari, how can I assist you today? Good afternoon Bakari, my name is Feruzi. I am calling about a child named Joseph from Kyerwa, Kagera. He is 17 years old and has been facing some serious issues with his education. I'm sorry to hear that, Feruzi. Can you please tell me more about what's been happening with Joseph's education? Yes, Joseph has been denied his right to education by his parents. They believe that he should drop out of school and start working to support the family. Joseph is a bright student with a lot of potential, and it's heartbreaking to see his future being jeopardized like this. That is indeed a serious violation of Joseph's rights. Every child has the right to education, regardless of their family's circumstances. Have you tried talking to Joseph's parents about the importance of education? Yes, I have tried to reason with them, but they are adamant about their decision. I fear that Joseph's future is at stake if this continues. I understand your concern, Feruzi. We can work together to find a solution for Joseph. I will connect you with our education experts who can provide guidance on how to advocate for Joseph's rights and ensure that he can continue his education. Thank you, Bakari. I appreciate your help in this matter. Joseph deserves a chance to fulfill his potential, and I will do everything I can to support him. You're welcome, Feruzi. We are here to support you and Joseph every step of the way. Together, we can make a difference in Joseph's life and ensure that his rights are protected.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Hadia speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Asukile. I'm 15 years old and I'm calling from Unguja Kaskazini B, Kaskazini Unguja. Nice to meet you, Asukile. How can I help you today? I... I don't know where to start. I've been feeling really overwhelmed lately. It's okay, Asukile. You can take your time. What's been happening? My parents have been arguing a lot at home, and I just can't take it anymore. I feel like I need to get away from all the yelling and screaming. I'm sorry to hear that, Asukile. It sounds like a really tough situation. Have you thought about where you might go? I've been thinking about running away, but I know it's not a good idea. I just don't know what else to do. I'm glad you reached out to us before making any decisions, Asukile. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Assa, how can I assist you today? Hey, Assa. My name is Zayn, I'm 16 years old and I'm calling from Musoma Vijijini in Mara. Hello, hello, is this the child helpline? I need some help with my nephew. Yes, this is Flavian from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Veronika, how can I assist you today? Hi Veronika, my name is Franklin. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Ambilikile, how can I assist you today? Hey, my name is Haki. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline, this is Eliana speaking. How can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Akili, I'm a 15-year-old boy from Same in Kilimanjaro. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline, this is Assa speaking. How can I assist you today? Hi Assa, my name is Babu and I'm calling about my niece Zawadi. Hi, umm, hello? Hello, this is Sabas from the child helpline. How can I help you today? Hi Sabas, my name is Barke. I'm 11 years old and I'm calling from Sikonge, Tabora. Nice to meet you, Barke. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline, this is Eveline speaking. How can I help you today? Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Anyelwiswe, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Jamila. I'm 13 years old and I'm calling from Mpwapwa, Dodoma. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Ruth speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi Ruth, my name is Ishara. Geni works with heavy machinery and is not provided with any protective gear. I fear for his safety and well-being. Thank you for sharing this information, Ishara. We will take immediate action to ensure Geni's safety and well-being. Your call is greatly appreciated in helping us protect children from such harmful situations.

Hello, is this the child helpline? Yes, this is Rahel from the child helpline. How can I help you today? Hi Rahel, my name is Mkuu, I'm 13 years old and I'm calling from Bariadi, Shinyanga. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Mwakamba speaking, how can I help you today? Hi, my name is Rosemary. I'm 13 years old and I live in Arusha Mjini, Arusha. Thank you for sharing your story with me.

Hello, Child Helpline, this is Violet speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, my name is Hope. I'm 11 years old, and I'm calling from Kishapu, Shinyanga. Nice to meet you, Hope. I want you to know that what you're experiencing is not your fault, Hope. You have the right to feel safe and respected. Would you like some advice on what steps you can take to address this situation? Yes, please. I don't want to feel scared every time I have to pass by the bus stand. You can also call the police or a local organization that deals with gender-based violence for further assistance. Thank you, Violet. I feel a little better now that I've talked to someone about this. I'll try to reach out for help. I'm glad you reached out, Hope. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Bakari speaking, how can I assist you today? Hello Bakari, my name is Petero. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Martina speaking, how can I assist you today? Hi, my name is Kami. I'm 16 years old and I'm calling from Kibondo, Kigoma. Hello, hi there! My name is Lisa, and I'm 17 years old. I'm calling from Musoma Vijijini in Mara. Oh, hello Lisa. This is Ali from the child helpline. How can I assist you today? Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline. This is Prisca, how can I assist you today? Hi Prisca, my name is Cornelius and I'm calling about a young girl named Amina. We can connect you with organizations that provide food assistance and support for families in need. Can you provide me with more details about Amina's family situation so we can better assist them? Yes, of course. Amina lives with her parents and three younger siblings. Her parents work as casual laborers and their income is unstable. And remember, you're doing a great job looking out for Yusra's well-being. Thank you, Safia. I will definitely keep that in mind. I appreciate your help and support.

Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian Child Helpline. This is Enzi, how can I assist you today? Hello Enzi, my name is Hanifa, and I am calling about a child named Edisa. Hello, thank you for calling the Tanzanian child helpline, this is Eunice. How can I assist you today? Hey there, my name is Azize, I'm 28 years old and I'm calling about a child named Russom. It's important for him to know that his worth is not solely based on his academic performance. Have you had a conversation with his parents about this issue? I've tried talking to them, but they believe that pushing Russom to do well in school is the best way to secure his future. I just don't want him to be consumed by this pressure at such a young age. I appreciate your concern, Azize. It's important for children to have a healthy balance between academics and their overall well-being. I can provide you with some resources and guidance on how to approach this situation with Russom's parents. Thank you for reaching out and advocating for Russom's well-being.

Hello, good afternoon. My name is Ambilikile, and I'm calling about a child in need of help. Hello, Ambilikile. I'm Mzee from the child helpline. How can I assist you today?
